Nature:- You are my only son. Out of my love for you, I want to give you some property. Therefore, I have a rightful ownership of a R.C.C. slab house and a reed house in Arlapadu village, Pellakur mandal, registered in my name in the Panchayat records and am paying taxes etc. Accordingly, as per the schedule available to me, the property listed below, valued at Rs. 5,55,000/- in words, is to be transferred to you gratuitously and taken into your possession, and you are also to take possession of it. Therefore, from this beginning, you and your heirs, sons and grandsons, shall have all the rights to receive, sell, exchange, and dispose of the property, including the treasury, water, stones, and other luxuries, and you shall enjoy it as a perpetual heir, and neither I nor my other heirs shall have any further right. The Scheduled Property is not subject to any objections or disputes or government dues till the date of handing over the Scheduled Property. If any disputes arise due to this Property, I will settle them at my own expense.
K. KantammaSheet Endorsement

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Document No. 401 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Komma Kantamma in favour of her Son, Kumba Bala Subramanyam, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 102 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 1-171, Assessment Number - 208859000151, comprised in survey number 340-21, situated in Arlapadu Village, Arthamala Grama Panchayath, Pellakur Mandal, within the District of Tirupati, registered at sub-registrar office Naidupet(910), is bounded as follows: North by: Sandhu Dhaari And House Of Ch. Srinivasulu South by: House Of K. Venkatesh East by: Vacant Site Of K.Gangaiah West by: House Of K. Gangaiah
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: 1. It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible. 2. It is noted that the Extent is handwritten in the the Annexure-1A, and hence the same may be verified by obtaining a Certified Copy from the concerned SRO, before proceeding to the loan process. Therefore, it is advisable for the F.I. to verify the same and proceed as per its internal policy
